corrections.explanation: "Convenience" is a noun, but you need to use the adjective "convenient" with "more".

incorrect sentence: One advantage is that it is more convenience to contact others by social media .
correct sentence: One advantage is that it is more convenient to contact others by social media .

corrections.explanation: Missing word. The correct expression is "in the old days", commonly used to refer to a period in the past in contrast to the period after something became available, which in the context of this paper would be social media.
Incorrect tense. This sentence is talking about something that happened in the past, so use the past tense, "wanted".
Incorrect tense. This sentence is talking about something that happened in the past, so use the past tense, "lived".
Incorrect tense. This sentence is talking about something that happened in the past, so use the past tense, "needed".

correct sentence: In the old days , if one wanted to tell some important news to another one , which lived far away , he needed to write letters and it wastes time .

corrections.explanation: Incorrect tense. This sentence is talking about something that happened in the past, so use the past tense, "made".
This sentence is talking about sending messages in general and therefore should not have an article.

incorrect sentence: The long distance and time-consuming make spreading the messages very difficult at that time .
correct sentence: The long distance and time-consuming made spreading messages very difficult at that time .

corrections.explanation: Incorrect tense. This sentence is talking about something that happened in the past and the verb goes with "something important" which is singular, so use the past singular, "was".

incorrect sentence: Therefore , people may not contact with the faraway friends and relatives unless there are something important .
correct sentence: Therefore , people may not contact with faraway friends and relatives unless there are was important .

corrections.explanation: Unnecessary word. The verb "contact" does not need the preposition "with" to connect it with who is being contacted, so please remove "with".

incorrect sentence: However , people now can contact with anyone all over the world who can use computer at any time , and there is no time delay of messages .
correct sentence: However , people now can contact anyone all over the world who can use computer at any time , and there is no time delay of messages .

corrections.explanation: "Online" is one word.

incorrect sentence: Unlike today , with the help with social media , people can easily get the information they want just by searching on line , and know about what that person did everyday at what time .
correct sentence: Unlike today , with the help with social media , people can easily get the information they want just by searching online , and know about what that person did everyday at what time .

corrections.explanation: Missing article. "Long time" is one instance of an unspecified amount of time, so use the indefinite article, "a".

incorrect sentence: As for the disadvantages of social media in our daily life , wasting time , causing illness related to sitting long time before the computer , quick-spread of rumor and fake news , most importantly , making people lost the ability to talk to others face to face confidently .
correct sentence: As for the disadvantages of social media in our daily life , wasting time , causing illness related to sitting a long time before the computer , quick-spread of rumor and fake news , most importantly , making people lost the ability to talk to others face to face confidently .

corrections.explanation: Incorrect preposition. You need to use "to" to indicate the direction of the action.
Unnecessary word. "Face" as a verb does not require the preposition "to" to indicate what you are facing.

incorrect sentence: It is weird that people sit around the table but all face to their phones and do not talk with each other .
correct sentence: It is weird that people sit around the table but all face their phones and do not talk with to other .

corrections.explanation: The sentence mentions more than one person, so there will be more than one head. Pluralise it as "some people bow their heads".

incorrect sentence: No matter it is a party , dinner or just simply get-together , there always are some people bow their head and playing their phones even their family and friends are in front of them .
correct sentence: No matter it is a party , dinner or just simply get-together , there always are some people bow their heads and playing their phones even their family and friends are in front of them .

corrections.explanation: Unnecessary word. The correct expression is "In conclusion".

incorrect sentence: In a conclusion , there are both advantages and disadvantages of using social media in daily life .
correct sentence: In conclusion , there are both advantages and disadvantages of using social media in daily life .

corrections.explanation: "Society" is an uncountable noun and therefore should not have an article.

incorrect sentence: The advantages and disadvantages of using such social media in the society are elaborated on as follows .
correct sentence: The advantages and disadvantages of using such social media in society are elaborated on as follows .

corrections.explanation: "Communication" in the sense of the act of exchanging ideas and information is an uncountable noun and should not be pluralised.

incorrect sentence: Social media is a trending channel and a suitable mean of communications .
correct sentence: Social media is a trending channel and a suitable mean of communication .

corrections.explanation: "Every" is used with a singular noun, so change "experiences" to "experience".

incorrect sentence: You can share photos , videos and every meaningful experiences of your life .
correct sentence: You can share photos , videos and every meaningful experience of your life .

corrections.explanation: "Society" is an uncountable noun and therefore should not have an article.

incorrect sentence: On the other hand , social media also has disadvantages which have created worries to the society recently and made it a controversial phenomenon .
correct sentence: On the other hand , social media also has disadvantages which have created worries to society recently and made it a controversial phenomenon .

corrections.explanation: As you are specifying which one of many worlds you are talking about (other examples might include the literary world, the academic world, the sports world, etc.), you need to use the definite article, "the".

correct sentence: More and more young people tend to live in the social media world most of their time and reduce face-to-face human contact , which can affect interpersonal skills and relationships in social life .

correct sentence: First and foremost , we should realize that the social media world is not trustworthy and real .

corrections.explanation: Incorrect conjugation. "Social media" is the third person singular, so use "does" to correspond with it.

correct sentence: Though social media does create relationships , relationships and friendships are only firm and real if people have gone through experiences and communication in face-to-face interaction .

correct sentence: She talked with them every night , trusted them and shared her life with them .

incorrect sentence: Then eventually , she discovered that eight people became one as he was using eight different identities to chat with her all the time .
correct sentence: Then eventually , she discovered that the eight people became one as he was using eight different identities to chat with her all the time .

corrections.explanation: Incorrect conjugation. "Situation" is the third person singular, so use "keeps" to correspond with it.

incorrect sentence: As a result , if the situation keep go on in this unexpected trend , it will cause a bad effect on the young generation .
correct sentence: As a result , if the situation keeps go on in this unexpected trend , it will cause a bad effect on the young generation .
